oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Three Interesting Cases and Small Ruminant Tips
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Roberson, Jerry R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: pet goats
goat production
surgical procedure
anemia
neurologic deficits
enlarged abdomen
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: More and more people have goats as pets, and goat production is on the increase. Owners are often willing to invest in more extensive medical and surgical procedures. Three interesting cases are discussed below. Although the clinical signs are common (anemia, neurologic deficits, and an enlarged abdomen), the actual diagnoses are relatively rare.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2010; 149-151
